intro: Glaucium secmenii, commonly known as the Armenian poppy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and its distinctive, ribbed, glaucous leaves. The plant belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known genera such as Papaver and Eschscholzia. Glaucium secmenii typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
